column1: The town can be reached by Dresdner Verkehrsbetriebe tram route 4 or by Dresden S-Bahn line S1
column2: which serves four stations in Radebeul (Radebeul Ost
column4: Radebeul Kötzschenbroda and Radebeul-Zitzschewig) on the Pirna–Coswig railway. Deutsche Bahn's Regional-Express 50 service also stops at Radebeul Ost. It is also the terminus of the historic Radebeul–Radeburg narrow-gauge steam railway and the station closest to the Karl May Museum.

column1: The volunteer fire department of Radebeul was founded in 1897. While volunteer
column2: it is considered the oldest department of the city government. Today the volunteer fire department of Radebeul consists of four separate quarter departments: Radebeul-Ost
column4: Lindenau and Wahnsdord. Each of the departments has his own junior firefighter section. The quarter department of Radebeul-Kötzschenbroda was founded 2008 in the course of the construction of a rescue central station in Radebeul West. In the process the volunteer fire departments of Radebeul-West and Naundorf were consolidated. The rescue central station also houses the "Technisches Hilfswerk Radebeul".

column1: In 2011 the departments counted 136 members in total
column2: 99 on active duty and 37 members in the elderly and honor department. The junior firefighter section had overall a number of 64 young members.
